meanings.definition: To separate into layers, as in the process of demulsifying oil and water.
meanings.sent1: Shaking the bottle vigorously demulsifies the mixture of oil and water.
meanings.sent2: The special detergent demulsifies the stubborn oil stains on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent3: The blender demulsifies the smoothie ingredients into a colorful swirl.
meanings.sent4: Her smile demulsifies the tension in the room, bringing a sense of calm.
meanings.sent5: The sun's heat demulsifies the frost on the car windshield, revealing a clear view.

meanings.definition: The action of breaking down or dispersing an emulsion.
meanings.sent1: The demulsifies of the salad dressing caused it to separate into oil and vinegar layers.
meanings.sent2: The demulsifies of the lotion made it easier to apply smoothly on the skin.
meanings.sent3: The demulsifies of the paint created a unique pattern on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The demulsifies of the clouds allowed the sun to shine through brightly.
meanings.sent5: The demulsifies of the traffic jam was a relief for commuters on their way home.
